parts.text:
### FOI Request Summary

This FOI request sought documents related to a 2023 Town Hall meeting, focusing on internal discussions and questions raised during the event, particularly in the context of public service ethics and accountability.

**Documents Released:**

*   **Transcript of 2023 Town Hall - produced by voice to text AI function:** Released in part due to s 22(1)(b)(ii) exemption (containing significant redactions).
*   **Transcript of Questions at 2023 Town Hall:** Released in full.

**Main Content from Documents:**

The released documents reveal a key discussion point during the 2023 Town Hall was the "Robodebt" scandal and its implications for ethical conduct within the public service.

*   **Concerns about Robodebt:** An anonymous question explicitly stated, "Some of us have been super concerned watching Robodebt. Could we have an independent ethics adviser, not an AEC SES, so if we need to consult someone we can."
*   **AEC's Response to Ethics Concerns:**
    *   The Moderator (Jeff) responded by acknowledging Robodebt as "terrible" and affirming that no similar behaviour or anything close to it had been observed within the AEC during his 10 years there.
    *   For independent advice, Jeff suggested the Australian Public Service Commission (APSC) and highlighted various other avenues for seeking advice or escalating concerns, including anonymously.
    *   The Electoral Commissioner, Tom Rogers, also addressed the "Robo debt question," echoing Jeff's sentiment and stating he had "certainly never seen anything like that, any systemic large scale events such as that internally in the AC," even going back 30-40 years in the AEC's history.
    *   A follow-up comment by another anonymous user and a moderator's reply further reinforced the APSC's Ethics Advisory Service as a resource, noting that the APS would be doing more work around integrity following the findings of Robodebt.

ELT Townhall 2023 - Transcript

Well, hi everyone. Uh, I'm Tom Rogers. For those that haven't met me, and I know we've got a number 
of new staff and I'm the electoral commissioner. Let me welcome you to this Town Hall and to start

respects to the elders past and present. So welcome. 

0:35 
These town halls have proven to be very popular. It's a great way of us being able to give you an 
agency wide update of what's occurring, but also importantly to give you the opportunity to ask any 
questions that you might have of any of the executive 

0:48 
for those that have been on these town halls before, you'll know the format. Each of us, each member 
of the executive is going to talk for a bit about what we're doing or issues that we think you might be 
interested in. 

1:01 
And at the same time, we'll have time for questions. So just to remind people, you can ask questions 
in a couple of different ways. You can wait till the end of everyone talking or if you've got a question 
on the way through, please ask it in the chat function, in the Q&A function. We'll do everything we 
possibly can to answer those questions. We've got a good track record of answering all of those 
questions. If we can't just because of time or it's too long, we'll take it on notice and come back to 
you. We'll either respond 

1:31 
and writing or I'll get one of the executive team to jump on and actually answer the question 
personally where we can. So again, thank you for that.

This is a comment in relation to a previous question about impartial ethics advice - the

reply from Moderator 
aps/integrity/ethics-advisory-service 
Moderator 
11/15/2023 2:47 PM 

Thanks for the comment. Following the findings of Robodebt the APS will be doing more 
work around this. You'll also see on the APSC website that there are a range of avenues 
open to raise concerns, including line managers harassment contact officers yees for 
dealing with concerns, central conduct or integrity units nominated individuals or 
teams in HR, including employee advice units or hotlines, or fraud prevention and 
control units or hotlines email reporting addresses ‘authorised officers’ who receive 
public interest disclosures.
